Name: Tabu
Ingredients: 30 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coconut shell or Collins glass .
Prepare garnish of pineapple cubes, Luxardo Maraschino Cherry & mint sprig.
BLEND all ingredients with 12oz scoop crushed ice.
Review: Ice-cold fresh pineapple laced with rum and vodka with a splash of citrus.
History: Adapted from Victor Bergeron 's Trader Vic's Bartender's Guide (1972 revised edition) where Vic states the drink "originated in Seattle".
Nutrition: One serving of Tabu contains 178 calories
